cards.name: Emberwilde Augur
cards.text: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: It deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: Legends say a djinn gave the goblins a gift they could never hope to master.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: Emberwilde Augur deals 3 damage to target player. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Flamewave Invoker
cards.text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.
cards.originalText: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Gempalm Incinerator
cards.text:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

rulings.text: The target of the ability can't be a creature with Protection from Creatures, with Protection from Goblins, or with Protection from Red.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins in play.

cards.name: Goblin Cohort
cards.text: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
cards.flavor: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.
cards.originalText: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've played a creature spell this turn.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: There's always room for one more.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Goblin Ringleader
cards.text:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Goblin Sledder
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let's play 'sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

rulings.text: Goblin Warchief's effect reduces only generic mana in the cost of Goblin spells you cast. For example, it doesn't reduce the cost of Skirk Prospector below {R}.

cards.originalText:
Goblin spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.

cards.name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
cards.text:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"

rulings.text: If you don't actually sacrifice the Goblin (because it was removed from the battlefield before the ability resolved, for example), no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it's too late to activate its ability before it's destroyed.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Mogg War Marshal
cards.text:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.
cards.originalText:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal comes into play or is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token into play.

cards.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
cards.text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.
cards.originalText: When Mudbutton Torchrunner is put into a graveyard from play, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.originalText: Haste

cards.name: Reckless One
cards.text:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Release chaos with me!"
cards.originalText:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins in play.

cards.name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
cards.text: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "I order you to volunteer."
cards.originalText: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it into play. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Skirk Fire Marshal
cards.text:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Skirk Prospector
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R}.
cards.flavor:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skirk Shaman
cards.text: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
cards.flavor: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Severed Legion.

cards.originalText: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.

cards.name: Tar Pitcher
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Boggart Shenanigans
cards.text: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Boggarts revel in discovering new sensations, from the texture of an otter pellet to the squeak of a dying warren mate.
cards.originalText: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from play, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"Within each of you is the strength of a landslide."
—Kumano, to his pupils
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals damage equal to the number of Mountains you control to target creature.

cards.name: Tarfire
cards.text: Tarfire deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"After Auntie brushed the soot from her eyes, she discovered something wonderful: the fire had turned the goat into something that smelled delicious."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
cards.originalText: Tarfire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Forgotten Cave
cards.text:
Forgotten Cave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Forgotten Cave comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elemental
cards.text: Trample
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Ezuri, Renegade Leader
cards.text:
{G}: Regenerate another target Elf.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Elf creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Great hero or grand betrayer? The truth of Ezuri's legacy is clouded by the fog of legend.

rulings.text: Ezuri's first ability can't affect itself, but its second ability does.

Only Elf creatures you control when the last ability resolves will get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn. Non-Elf creatures that become Elves or Elf creatures that enter the battlefield under your control later in the turn won't get the bonuses.

foreignNames.name: 背教の主導者、エズーリ

cards.originalText:
{G}: Regenerate another target Elf.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Elf creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen
cards.text:
Reach
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen attacks, you gain 1 life for each attacking Elf you control.
cards.flavor: "This is our land. We will not allow eyeblights to poison its beauty."

rulings.text: Count the number of attacking Elves you control as Dwynen's last ability resolves to determine how much life to gain.

foreignNames.name: 光り葉の将帥、ドゥイネン

cards.originalText:
Reach
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen attacks, you gain 1 life for each attacking Elf you control.

cards.name: Dwynen's Elite
cards.text: When Dwynen's Elite enters the battlefield, if you control another Elf, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor: Call one, call them all.
cards.originalText: When Dwynen's Elite enters the battlefield, if you control another Elf, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

cards.name: Elvish Aberration
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G}.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.

Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G}.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Elvish Archdruid
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} for each Elf you control.
cards.flavor: "The elves tend the forest, and the forest sustains the elves. My role is to ensure that the cycle continues."

rulings.text: Elvish Archdruid's first ability affects only other Elves you control. However, Elvish Archdruid's second ability counts all Elves you control — including itself.
Elvish Archdruid's activated ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and players can't respond to it.

cards.originalText:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} for each Elf you control.

cards.name: Elvish Branchbender
cards.text: {T}: Until end of turn, target Forest becomes an X/X Treefolk creature in addition to its other types, where X is the number of Elves you control.
cards.flavor: "How do the vinebred feel? Fah! We do not ask the puppet how it feels when the puppeteer bids it dance."

rulings.text: The value of X is determined when the ability resolves. It won't change later, even if the number of Elves you control changes.

If you control no Elves when the ability resolves, the Forest will become a 0/0 creature and be put into the graveyard. However, since Elvish Branchbender is itself an Elf, the Forest will usually be at least a 1/1.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {T}: Until end of turn, target Forest becomes an X/X Treefolk creature in addition to its other types, where X is the number of Elves you control.

cards.name: Elvish Mystic
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
"Life grows everywhere. My kin merely find those places where it grows strongest."
—Nissa Revane
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.name: Elvish Vanguard
cards.text: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.
cards.flavor: "Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."

rulings.text: If Elvish Vanguard enters the battlefield at the same time as another Elf, its ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.

cards.name: Ezuri's Archers
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Ezuri's Archers blocks a creature with flying, Ezuri's Archers gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Eyes and arrows trained ever skyward.

rulings.text: If Ezuri's Archers somehow blocks multiple creatures with flying (perhaps because it's equipped by Echo Circlet), its ability triggers that many times.

cards.originalText:
Reach
Whenever Ezuri's Archers blocks a creature with flying, Ezuri's Archers gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fierce Empath
cards.text: When Fierce Empath enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Fierce Empath enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Gladehart Cavalry
cards.text:
When Gladehart Cavalry enters the battlefield, support 6. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to six other target creatures.)
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it dies, you gain 2 life.

rulings.text: If Gladehart Cavalry dies at the same time as a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it, its ability will trigger.
If Gladehart Cavalry somehow gets a +1/+1 counter, it dying will cause its own ability to trigger.
You gain 2 life per creature, not per +1/+1 counter.
You can't put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don't control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.originalText:
When Gladehart Cavalry enters the battlefield, support 6. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to six other target creatures.)
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it dies, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Ivy Lane Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another green creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: "Skyknight gear? Well, I have drake-skin gauntlets, supple and fireproof. Or a ceratok chestplate that'll stop a crossbow bolt."

rulings.text: The green creature that entered the battlefield can be chosen as the target of Ivy Lane Denizen's ability.
Ivy Lane Denizen can be chosen as the target of its own ability.

cards.originalText: Whenever another green creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Jagged-Scar Archers
cards.text:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.
{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.
cards.originalText:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.
{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Krosan Tusker
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. (Do this before you draw.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle this card, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Kujar Seedsculptor
cards.text: When Kujar Seedsculptor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
cards.flavor: Every leaf, tree, and building in Kujar has been placed to achieve maximum harmony, in accordance with the elvish philosophy known as the Great Conduit.

rulings.text: Kujar Seedsculptor can be the target of its own triggered ability.

foreignNames.name: クジャールの種子彫刻家

cards.originalText: When Kujar Seedsculptor enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

cards.name: Lead the Stampede
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Leaf Gilder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana, ordered hundreds of trees uprooted and rearranged into a pattern he deemed beautiful. Thus the Gilt-Leaf Wood was born.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.name: Llanowar Empath
cards.text: When Llanowar Empath enters the battlefield, scry 2, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it into your hand. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText: When Llanowar Empath enters the battlefield, scry 2, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it into your hand. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The remains of ancient civilizations litter the run-down land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Nature's Way
cards.text: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
cards.flavor: Many elves incorporate the beauty of nature into their inventions. Very few capture its savagery.

rulings.text: You can't cast Nature's Way unless you choose both a creature you control and a creature you don't control as targets.
If either target is an illegal target as Nature's Way resolves, no damage will be dealt.
If the creature you don't control is an illegal target as Nature's Way tries to resolve, the creature you control will still gain vigilance and trample.
Trample only applies to the assignment of combat damage, not the damage Nature's Way has the creature deal.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control gains vigilance and trample until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Nissa's Judgment
cards.text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Choose up to one target creature an opponent controls. Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

rulings.text: You finish the support action before any creatures deal damage. Creatures that get a +1/+1 counter will deal damage to the creature an opponent controls, if applicable.

As Nissa's Judgment resolves, if at least one of its targets is still legal, it will resolve, affecting only targets that are still legal at that time. If none of its targets are still legal at that time, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.
You can't put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don't control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.originalText:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Choose up to one target creature an opponent controls. Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

cards.name: Regal Force
cards.text: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.
cards.flavor: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.

rulings.text: If Regal Force is still on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, its ability will count itself.

cards.originalText: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.

cards.name: Sylvan Advocate
cards.text:
Vigilance
As long as you control six or more lands, Sylvan Advocate and land creatures you control get +2/+2.
cards.flavor: "The land gives of itself. Its abundance provides, even in times of chaos."

rulings.text: A "land creature" is a permanent that's both a land and a creature.

Damage remains marked on creatures until the turn ends. If Sylvan Advocate's ability stops applying (because Sylvan Advocate leaves the battlefield or you no longer control six or more lands), then any land creatures that needed the toughness bonus to stay alive will be destroyed.

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
As long as you control six or more lands, Sylvan Advocate and land creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.name: Talara's Battalion
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
Trample
cards.flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.
cards.originalText:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
Trample

cards.name: Viridian Shaman
cards.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンのシャーマン

cards.originalText: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Wildheart Invoker
cards.text: {8}: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Life as we know it dangles on the brink of extinction. We must show the strength they would steal from us."
—The Invokers' Tales
cards.originalText: {8}: Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Yeva, Nature's Herald
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
You may cast green creature spells as though they had flash.
cards.flavor: "I can call an army to my side in the blink of an eye. Best not blink."

rulings.text: You still pay the costs for green creature cards you cast.

Yeva's ability applies to green creature cards in any zone, provided something is allowing you to cast them. For example, if the top card of your library is a green creature card and you control Garruk's Horde, you can cast that card as though it had flash.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
You may cast green creature spells as though they had flash.

cards.name: Oran-Rief, the Vastwood
cards.text:
Oran-Rief, the Vastwood enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each green creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

rulings.text: Oran-Rief's third ability cares about permanents' characteristics at the time the ability resolves, not their characteristics at the time they entered the battlefield. For example, if a blue creature enters the battlefield, then is turned green by a spell or ability, then Oran-Rief's second ability resolves, you'll put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
Oran-Rief's second ability affects all permanents that are green creatures that entered the battlefield this turn, not just the ones you control.

cards.originalText:
Oran-Rief, the Vastwood enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each green creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

cards.name: Tranquil Thicket
cards.text:
Tranquil Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Tranquil Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Treetop Village
cards.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.name: Goblin Welder
cards.text: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.

rulings.text: As the new wording makes clear, both targets must still be legal as the ability resolves in order for it to do anything. If either one or both has become illegal, nothing gets sacrificed and nothing gets returned to the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.

cards.name: Artificer's Epiphany
cards.text: Draw two cards. If you control no artifacts, discard a card.
cards.flavor: The artificers of Kaladesh strive ceaselessly for perfection, progress, and the ultimate expression of elegance.

rulings.text: If you control at least one artifact as Artificer's Epiphany resolves, you can't discard a card, even if you want to.

cards.originalText: Draw two cards. If you control no artifacts, discard a card.

cards.name: Etherium Sculptor
cards.text: Artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: The greatest masters of the craft abandon tools altogether, shaping metal with hand and mind alone.

rulings.text: The only difference between a colored artifact and a colorless artifact is, obviously, its color. Unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact requires colored mana to cast. Also unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact has a color in all zones. It will interact with cards that care about color. Other than that, a colored artifact behaves just like any other artifact. It will interact as normal with any card that cares about artifacts, such as Shatter or Arcbound Ravager.

This effect doesn't change the mana cost or converted mana cost of an artifact spell. Rather, it reduces the total cost of the spell, which is the amount you actually pay while casting it. The total cost takes into account additional or alternative costs.
This effect can reduce only the generic portion of the artifact spell's total cost.

foreignNames.name: エーテリウムの彫刻家

cards.originalText: Artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.originalText:

cards.name: Riddlesmith
cards.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
cards.flavor: The Neurok see the artificer as an archaeologist, clearing away falsehoods to see the truth hidden beneath.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.name: Treasure Mage
cards.text: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If a card in your library has X in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

cards.originalText: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Trinket Mage
cards.text: When Trinket Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If the mana cost of a card in your library includes {X}, X is considered to be 0.

cards.originalText: When Trinket Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Trophy Mage
cards.text: When Trophy Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 3, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "The tools of the past will help us forge the future."

rulings.text: Trophy Mage's ability finds an artifact card with converted mana cost exactly 3.

cards.originalText: When Trophy Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 3, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Whirler Rogue
cards.text:
When Whirler Rogue enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.
Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: You may tap any two untapped artifacts you control, including artifact creatures that haven't been under your control continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.
Activating the second ability of Whirler Rogue after a creature has become blocked won't cause it to become unblocked.

cards.originalText:

cards.flavor: The elves had devised countless strategies to combat Memnarch's war machines, but they had no idea what to do when one was thrown at them.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Barrage Ogre deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.name: Shrapnel Blast
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: From trinket to trauma.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one artifact to cast this spell; you can't cast it without sacrificing an artifact, and you can't sacrifice additional artifacts.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the artifact you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to any target.

cards.name: Welding Sparks
cards.text: Welding Sparks deals X damage to target creature, where X is 3 plus the number of artifacts you control.
cards.flavor:
"The fires of invention burn in all of us. I fight for the freedom to unleash those flames."
—Pia Nalaar

rulings.text: If you control zero artifacts, Welding Sparks deals 3 damage to the target creature.
The number of artifacts you control is counted only as Welding Sparks resolves.

cards.originalText: Welding Sparks deals X damage to target creature, where X is 3 plus the number of artifacts you control.

cards.name: Maverick Thopterist
cards.text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
When Maverick Thopterist enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.

rulings.text: Improvise doesn't change a spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.

When calculating a spell's total cost, include any alternative costs, additional costs, or anything else that increases or reduces the cost to cast the spell. Improvise applies after the total cost is calculated.
Improvise can't pay for {W}, {U}, {B}, {R}, {G}, or {C} mana symbols in a spell's total cost.

Improvise can't be used to pay for anything other than the cost of casting the spell. For example, it can't be used during the resolution of an ability that says "Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}."

If an artifact you control has a mana ability with {T} in the cost, activating that ability while casting a spell with improvise will result in the artifact being tapped when you pay the spell's costs. You won't be able to tap it again for improvise. Similarly, if you sacrifice an artifact to activate a mana ability while casting a spell with improvise, that artifact won't be on the battlefield when you pay the spell's costs, so you won't be able to tap it for improvise.
Tapping an artifact won't cause its abilities to stop applying unless those abilities say so.
Equipment attached to a creature doesn't become tapped when that creature becomes tapped, and tapping that Equipment doesn't cause the creature to become tapped.

When using improvise to cast a spell with {X} in its mana cost, first choose the value for X. That choice, plus any cost increases or decreases, will determine the spell's total cost. Then you can tap artifacts you control to help pay that cost. For example, if you cast Saheeli's Directive and choose X to be 3, the total cost is {3}{R}{R}{R}. If you tap two artifacts, you'll have to pay {1}{R}{R}{R}.

cards.originalText:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
When Maverick Thopterist enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.

cards.name: Reclusive Artificer
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Reclusive Artificer enters the battlefield, you may have it deal damage to target creature equal to the number of artifacts you control.
cards.flavor: It's not wise to disturb an artist at work.

rulings.text: Count the number of artifacts you control as Reclusive Artificer's triggered ability resolves to determine how much damage it deals.

If you are the only player who controls a creature when Reclusive Artificer's second ability triggers, you must choose one of those creatures as the target, although you can choose to not deal it damage.

cards.name: Mycosynth Wellspring
cards.text: When Mycosynth Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.

rulings.text: The ability will trigger when Mycosynth Wellspring is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, even if the ability that triggered when it entered the battlefield hasn't resolved yet.

cards.originalText: When Mycosynth Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Myr Battlesphere
cards.text:
When Myr Battlesphere enters the battlefield, create four 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens.
Whenever Myr Battlesphere attacks, you may tap X untapped Myr you control. If you do, Myr Battlesphere gets +X/+0 until end of turn and deals X damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.

rulings.text: You choose the value for X as the last ability resolves. You can't choose a value for X that's greater than the number of untapped Myr you control.

You can tap any untapped Myr you control as the last ability resolves, not just the Myr tokens you put onto the battlefield with the first ability. This includes Myr that haven't been under your control since your most recent turn began.

As the last ability resolves, you can tap untapped Myr you control even if Myr Battlesphere is no longer on the battlefield by then. If that has happened, Myr Battlesphere won't be able to get the +X/+0 bonus, but it will still deal X damage to the defending player.

cards.originalText:
When Myr Battlesphere enters the battlefield, create four 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens.
Whenever Myr Battlesphere attacks, you may tap X untapped Myr you control. If you do, Myr Battlesphere gets +X/+0 until end of turn and deals X damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.
